climbs.name: Day Care Left
climbs.fa: Staff from the Bible Camp across the street in the 1970's

content.description:
This is the left hand scrambly climb. It starts just before the gully’s headwall.  It goes to a chain and quick link anchor under the route 'Slab'.



Far left line of bolts on the lower tier.

Bolts

climbs.name: Day Care Middle
climbs.fa: Staff from the Bible Camp across the street in the 1970's

content.description:
This is the middle of the three lower routes.  There is a chain and quick linked bolt on the rock at the ledge



Middle climb on the lower tier.

Bolts

climbs.name: Day Care Right
climbs.fa: Staff from the Bible Camp across the street in the 1970's

content.description:
The furthest route on the right on the lower tier. It ends at the base of pinnacle on a bulge.



Furthest right climb on the lower tier.

Bolts

climbs.name: Friction
climbs.fa: Top roped by Bible Campers in the 1970’s, first bolted and led by Daniel Vanderpyl in 2022.

content.description:
The middle roof crux can be a doozy. Get high feet.



To the right of 'Slab'. This is the middle climb on the upper tier.

5 Bolts

climbs.name: Pillory
climbs.fa: Staff from the Bible Camp across the street in the 1970's

content.description:
Climb up the flakes to the top of the pillar.  This is usually top roped, but it can be led with a number of micro-nuts. 



Far right bulge/pillar on the upper ledge.

Trad, TR

climbs.name: Pinnacle
climbs.fa: Staff from the Bible Camp across the street in the 1970's

content.description:
Follow up the bolts. If you are top roping, bring a large sling for an anchor since the bolts are far apart up there.



The bolted low-angle face right of friction. The rightmost bolted line on the upper tier.

Bolts

climbs.name: Slab
climbs.fa: Ralph Eckman and the Medicine Hat Climbing Club, 2004.

content.description:
Follow a line of 3 bolts which go up a smooth slab immediately left of a left corner.  The climb ends at a ring bolt just underneath a small roof.  There is some good exposure on this one.



The start is on the far left side of the upper tier on which Friction and Pinnacle start.

3 Bolts

The harder unsent climbs on the left have been around for decades. They - allegedly - go at around 5.13 (left) and 5.12 (right). Then on the right of the Quarry there are the easy climbs on the lower bench and some fun moderate climbs on the upper bench. The lower section is perfect for beginner lead climbs; or walk around and set up some top ropes. 
  
 Be cautious using this crag in the early spring. It is at the base of a ~2,500ft gully and spring avalanches have come all the way to the bottom before. Check the snow patches up high by driving an extra 300m down the highway after the pullout to see the whole northwest face of Sentry. The gully has not been known to provide rockfall hazard in the summertime.
